title: Coronation Street writers appear to forget Mike Baldwin is dead in epic blunder
text:
Coronation Street writers appear to forget Mike Baldwin is dead in epic blunder Adam Barlow was looking for his deceased father in the Rovers Return Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Would you sleep with Ken Barlow? Coronation Street's script writers made a serious gaffe tonight. 
During a scene at the Rovers Return, Todd Grimshaw told his partner Billy Mayhew that Adam Barlow had been looking for his dad in the pub. 
However, his father is Mike Baldwin, who was killed off the show 11 years ago. 
Those tuning in at home couldn't help but notice the epic blunder and were quick to take to Twitter afterwards. Todd Grimshaw told his partner Billy Mayhew that Adam Barlow had been looking for his father - who has been dead for 11 years 
One wrote: "Todd says Adam is 'looking for his Dad' in the Rovers...he'd have a job finding Mike Baldwin now... #Corrie @itvcorrie." 
Another then posted: "Did Todd just say Adam was looking for his dad?! He'll be looking a long time, his dad is Mike Baldwin and he's been dead years #Corrie." 
Shortly afterwards, a different viewer commented: "@itvcorrie Todd just said Adam was looking for his Dad in the Rovers?? Isn't Mike Baldwin his Dad?? Have a shock if he found him eh!!!!" 
Moments later, another tweeted: "@itvcorrie why did Todd say to Billy that Adam was looking for his dad? His dad is dead!" Adam's grandfather is Ken Barlow (Photo: ITV) Mike Baldwin is Adam's real father 
A likely explanation for the blunder is that Todd was supposed to say Adam was looking for his granddad, Ken Barlow. 
But if he was genuinely searching for his deceased father, he's in for a big surprise!
